prompt_text:
Write a compassionate, respectful thank-you letter for a donor who gave $[AMOUNT]
to [ORGANIZATION NAME] in [HONOR/MEMORY] of [HONOREE NAME]. The letter should:

- Express gratitude for the gift while acknowledging the significance of honoring someone
- Use appropriate, sensitive language for [MEMORIAL/TRIBUTE] context
- Explain how the gift will create meaningful impact in [HONOREE NAME]'s name
- Mention that [HONOREE FAMILY NAME/PERSON] will be notified of the gift (but not the amount)
- Include the specific program or fund: [PROGRAM/FUND NAME]
- Offer to send acknowledgment card to family if desired
- Be respectful, warm, and sincere without being overly emotional
- Be 200-300 words
- Use a [COMPASSIONATE/RESPECTFUL/WARM] tone
- Be signed by [SIGNER NAME and TITLE]

The letter should honor both the donor's generosity and the person being remembered
or celebrated. Strike a balance between gratitude and sensitivity to loss or
celebration. Avoid platitudes or overly religious language unless you know the donor.

scenarios.name: Small Community Org
scenarios.description: Rural, volunteer-led food pantry in Appalachian Kentucky serving families facing food insecurity; local individual donor made a memorial gift honoring a longtime volunteer.

scenarios.name: Mid-Size Arts Education Org
scenarios.description: Urban arts education nonprofit serving public school students across the city; alumni parents and community members make tribute gifts honoring educators.

scenarios.name: Large Hospital Foundation
scenarios.description: Established children’s hospital foundation in a major metro area supporting research and family services; major donor made a memorial gift honoring a patient.

Dear [Donor Name],

On behalf of the entire team at Hollow Creek Community Pantry, please accept our deepest gratitude for your thoughtful donation of $150 to our Fresh Food Access Fund. We are especially touched that you chose to make this gift in memory of Martha Ellis. Your kindness in remembering her in such a meaningful way is truly heartwarming.

We understand that making a donation in someone's memory is a deeply personal gesture, and we are honored that you entrusted us with this tribute to Martha. Gifts like yours allow us to continue our vital work, ensuring that our neighbors have consistent access to nutritious, fresh food. Through your generosity, more families in our community will receive the healthy meals they need, and this positive impact will be a lasting testament to Martha’s memory.

We want to inform you that we will be notifying the Ellis family of your thoughtful donation, letting them know that a gift has been made to Hollow Creek Community Pantry in Martha's honor. Please be assured that your specific donation amount will not be shared with the family. If you would like us to send them a separate acknowledgment card from our organization, please let us know, and we will be happy to do so.

Thank you once again for your compassion and generosity. Your support not only helps us provide essential services but also allows Martha Ellis's legacy of care to continue touching lives in our community.

With sincere appreciation,

Rosa Jiménez
Executive Director
